About This Package

evanverse is an R package providing utility functions for data analysis, visualization, and bioinformatics workflows. It’s organized as a standard R package with roxygen2 documentation and testthat testing framework.

Development Commands

Testing

# Run all tests
R -e "devtools::test()"

# Run a specific test file
R -e "testthat::test_file('tests/testthat/test-[function_name].R')"

# Check package integrity
R -e "devtools::check()"

Documentation

# Generate documentation from roxygen2 comments
R -e "devtools::document()"

# Build and preview pkgdown site
R -e "pkgdown::build_site()"

Package Building

# Install package locally for testing
R -e "devtools::install()"

# Build source package
R -e "devtools::build()"

# Load package for interactive development
R -e "devtools::load_all()"

Architecture Overview

Core Function Categories

  1. Data Handling (R/ files with data processing functions)
    • Void value utilities (*_void.R files) - handle NA/NULL/empty values
    • Custom infix operators (percent_*_operator.R) - %is%, %nin%, %p%, %match%, %map%
    • Data transformation functions (df2list.R, map_column.R, read_table_flex.R)
  2. Visualization & Palettes (plot_*.R and *_palette*.R files)
    • Plotting functions: plot_venn(), plot_pie(), plot_bar(), plot_density(), plot_forest()
    • Color management system with JSON-based palette storage
    • Bio-focused color palettes with compilation system
  3. Bioinformatics Utilities (gmt2*.R, convert_gene_id.R, download_gene_ref.R)
    • Gene set analysis tools (GMT file handling)
    • Gene ID conversion utilities
    • Reference data download functions
  4. Package Management (*_pkg.R files)
    • Multi-source package installation (inst_pkg() supports CRAN, GitHub, Bioconductor)
    • Package checking and updating utilities
  5. File & Network Operations (file_*.R, download_*.R)
    • File system utilities and directory trees
    • URL downloading with flexible options
    • Excel/table reading with enhanced flexibility

Package Structure Conventions

  • All functions have corresponding test files in tests/testthat/test-[function_name].R
  • Documentation generated via roxygen2 comments in source files
  • Function overview maintained in R/_overview.md for reference
  • Uses standard R package structure with DESCRIPTION, NAMESPACE, man/ docs
  • pkgdown site configuration in _pkgdown.yml for documentation website

Key Dependencies

  • Core: tidyverse ecosystem (dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2), data.table
  • Bioinformatics: Biobase, GSEABase, GEOquery, biomaRt
  • File I/O: openxlsx, readxl, jsonlite, curl
  • Utilities: cli, fs, tictoc, withr

Testing Strategy

  • Uses testthat framework with edition 3
  • Network-dependent tests marked with skip_on_cran() or specific skip conditions
  • Some tests skip network-heavy operations (download functions)
  • Tests cover all major function categories with individual test files per function

Documentation

  • Package website built with pkgdown using “sandstone” bootswatch theme
  • Two main vignettes: “get-started” and “package-management”
  • All functions documented with roxygen2, exported via NAMESPACE
  • Function reference organized by category in pkgdown site
